TopicTitle: Hey, this is my first topic.

Articles.Content:
Hello KSP community.

I, a random kid on the internet, have stumbled across this wonderful game. I know what half of you are already thinking. A kid? On a forum? The community is dead. I assure you not. While most of my brethren in age are immature or (to be frank) idiotic, I can almost guarantee you that this is not the case. I can be mature, enjoy humor, and even support or help the community! Giving back is always great, yes?

Now to business, the game itself. I have only a hour or two under my belt, but I already love it. And the fact that it is in Alpha, and under heavy development? Truly amazing.

Some of my current achievements in the game are going out of the atmosphere and creating a ship that lands and takes off again. What I am working on now is reaching the moon, or mun, as it be.

I plan on donating, and officially buying the game, as soon as a credit or debt pay system is reached. I am a kid, after all, and Paypal is clearly above my intellectual levels.

Now to something that is probably going to make you mad. Scanning this lovely community, I have discovered a hatred for a certain Youtube channel. The Yogscast. I am actually subscribed to these Brits. Now what really sucks? You guys are correct about them. Well, not the group itself, but about its community. Besides a couple of uncommon mature supporters, most of the Yogscast community is.. childish. I won\'t go further into detail because it is difficult bashing on my own community. The video makers themselves are pretty humorous though, and I feel ashamed you all are judging them horribly because of the mass of idiots who subscribe to them.

And with this, I bid my welcome. Also, I am going to try this Marquee text option.. I never saw it before.

[move]Hello[/move]

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Hello, twin brother.

I am also a \'deserving\' child on the forums!
Thank you all for the wonderful welcomes. I *plan* on becoming a forum veteran in no time. But that pesky social life might prevent this.

The Yogcast videos aren\'t quite informative, and if they try to 'teach' first-time viewers who don\'t know who Jeb is, they get the wrong idea, example, and so forth.

It\'s really just a shame that there are several tutorials out there who put their effort and hard work into it, and now some famous person(s) got the idea to make their own tutorial video, or as they call it. I wouldn\'t doubt it if they haven\'t had the game for more than a few mesley days.

But out of this ocean of misinformed kids, you seem to be floating well above the sinking rest.

While most of my brethren in age are immature or (to be frank) idiotic, I can almost guarantee you that this is not the case. I can be mature, enjoy humor, and even support or help the community! Giving back is always great, yes?

Yes, I understand, it can be hard to pull away association from the \'masses\'. I too am a \'kid\' (16 years old). I can code in C++ and develop addons, what a suprise for someone my age! =P

Anyway, welcome to the Kerbal Space Program forums and I hope you enjoy your stay here, Mr. Pointless (interesting name). ;D
